Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Peru and Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Peru and Egypt 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was separately brought out in booklet by the Por Publilaser of Peru and the Dar Al-Shaab Publishing House of Egypt on Oct. 6 and 9.
 The work made public on Oct. 2, Juche 84 (1995) is an immortal programme for party building and activities, which proudly reviewed the glorious history of the WPK which pioneered the new way of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicated the way to strengthen the WPK into the eternal party of the President.

Brazilian Political Figure on Development of Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Brazilian Political Figure on Development of Relations with WPK 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Eduardo Azeredo, chairman of the Social Democratic Party of Brazil, when meeting the DPRK ambassador to Brazil who paid a courtesy call on him on Oct. 8, said that the party was pleased to have an opportunity to establish new ties with the Workers' Party of Korea which has a long tradition and history and develop them.
 He underscored the need to boost the relations between the two parties.

South Korean Youth and Students Vow to Intensify Actions for Withdrawal of U.S. Troops
articles.content:
South Korean Youth and Students Vow to Intensify Actions for Withdrawal of U.S. Troops 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The 3rd conference of the 3rd term of the Youth and Students Solidarity for the Implementation of the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea was reportedly held in Seoul on Oct. 9.
 Accusing the public security authorities of issuing a warrant of arrest to Song Hyo Won, 13th term-chairperson of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils, on charges of the struggle for the removal of MacArthur's statue held in Inchon on Sept. 11, the resolutions read out at the conference termed this a dastardly move of the pro-U.S. conservative forces to crack down upon the youth and students who would steer the present era of reunification and, furthermore, chill the people's growing desire for independence and reunification and bedevil the inter-Korean relations.
 They also made it clear that the youth and students would join hands with people from all walks of life in their struggle to win the legalization of the patriotic organizations for reunification including the South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification and the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils and get their members delisted as political offenders and their detained comrades released. 
 They declared that the youth and students would wage a more dynamic struggle to get the "Security Law", anti-reunification law, totally abolished and throw overboard the pro-U.S. conservative forces.    
 The resolutions also assailed the U.S. for insisting that "north Korea abandon its nuclear program first" even before the ink on the joint statement of the six-party talks got dry. The U.S. troops in south Korea are the biggest barrier lying in the way of achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula, they added.
 The youth and students will intensify the struggle for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea, the resolutions stressed.

articles.title: Amendment to Law on Past History Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Amendment to Law on Past History Urged in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The All-People Committee for Proper Settlement of the Past History, the People's Solidarity for Inheriting the Spirit of the Movement for Democracy and other civic and public organizations of south Korea reportedly held a press conference on Oct. 10 at which they demanded an amendment to the law on the past history.
 Speakers at the conference referred to the deplorable situation where victims of the "Security Law" are subject to reinvestigation under the existing law on the past history.    
 Charging that the law is obstructive to the probe into the past history, they called for scrapping the poisonous articles of the law as soon as possible.
 They declared that they would tour all parts of south Korea in demand of the revision of the law on the past history, a tattered one, and hold meetings to hear testimonies of its victims and, at the same time, stage actions to have the amendment to the law placed on the agenda of the "National Assembly."

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets Thai Party Delegation

Kim Ki Nam Meets Thai Party Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C. C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Monday met and had a friendly talk with the visiting delegation of the Thai Rak Thai Party headed by Krasae Chanawongse, adviser to Leader of the party Thaksin Shinawatra who is prime minister of Thailand.
